body.p: The structure of a Hugo website is simple to understand. This sections explains each folders and how they can be configured to suit your complex needs.

p.screen: . ├── archetypes ├── config.toml ├── content ├── data ├── layouts ├── static └── themes

section.title: archetypes
section.p: All types of contents used by your Hugo websites are defined. They are basically templates on how posts should look like.

section.title: config.toml
section.p: You should edit this file before deployment as it contains vital information about your website. A typical config file looks like:

p.screen: baseURL = "https://example.org/" languageCode = "en-us" title = "My New Hugo Site" theme = "ananke"

section.title: content
section.p: All contents for your website belong here. The sections and categories of your website determines how this folder can be structured.

section.title: data
section.p: Configuration files used by Hugo when generating your website are stored here. You can also create data templates here to generate data from dynamic contents.

section.title: layouts
section.p: HTML files that describe the appearance of your website are stored here. You should only edit these files if you know what you are doing.

section.title: static
section.p: All CSS, JavaScript, image, and other static files used by Hugo are stored here.

section.title: themes
section.p: All downloaded Hugo themes should be stored under this folder.
